result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

5:05 PM Defendant Efrain N Cruz appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court received updated report from Public Defender and have not appointed yet.
Deft will wait another week for Public Defender - Clerk to send paperwork for Court Appointed Atty.
Deft requests bond  modification.
court will take up on Monday.

Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:12 PM Defendant Efrain N Cruz appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for a public defender and is awaiting appointment. Court explains the court appointed counsel program. Defendant requests a petition be sent to the DC. Defendant asks the court if he is allowed to talk to his mother. Court said there is no condition the prohibits communication. Clerk sends petition w/NOH interoffice to the DC.
4:43 PM Court recalls case to explain to Efrain N Cruz that he can talk to his parents but is not to discuss the merits of the case with them.  Can discuss hiring an attorney.

1:53 PM Defendant Efrain N Cruz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ali M Mahmood appeared by video for Efrain N Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Given complaint/waived reading-Advised of Rights-Bond set-Preliminary hearing requested-950/Marsy's Law complied with-No alternative address given-Qualifies for services-Defense objects to counts 1 & 5 as, there is no P.C. for intercourse-Court finds P.C. in the complaint.
